required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I Open Label Trial to Assess Safety of BIBW 2992 (Afatinib) in Combination With Herceptin® in Patients With HER2-positive Advanced Breast Cancer.
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Open Label Trial to Assess Safety of BIBW 2992 in Combination With Herceptin® in Patients With HER2-positive Advanced Breast Cancer.

brief_summary.textblock: Study to determine the Maximum Tolerated dose of BIBW 2992 given in combination with Herceptin®

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with DLT in the first cycle (28 days) for the determination of the maximum tolerated dose (MTD). Important Limitations and Caveats are provided in the respective section.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Afatinib in Combination With Herceptin(R)
primary_outcome.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose at which no more than 1 of 6 patients experienced DLT. It was determined using a standard 3 + 3 dose escalation cohort design. To confirm the MTD, the MTD cohort was to be expanded to 18 patients with no more than 3/18 patients experiencing a DLT. Please refer to CAVEATs and Limitations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Objective Response (OR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd cycle until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Objective tumor response based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. OR is defined as complete response (CR) or partial response (PR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Best Overall Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd cycle until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Best overall response based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Best overall response is defined as complete response (CR), partial response (PR), stable disease (SD), progressive disease (PD) or not evaluable.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression, death or data cut-off.
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as time from randomisation to disease progression or death whichever occurs first. Assessed by central independent review according to the response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST 1.1). Median time results from unstratified Kaplan-Meier estimates.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Concentration of Afatinib in Plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.05 hours (h) before dosing and 0.5-1h, 2h, 3h, 4h, 5h, 6h, 8h after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Pre-dose Concentrations of Afatinib in Plasma at Steady State on Days 8, 15 and 29 (Cpre,ss,8, Cpre,ss,15 and Cpre,ss,29) and Maximum Concentration of Afatinib in Plasma at Steady State (Cmax,ss).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time From Dosing to the Maximum Concentration of Afatinib in Plasma at Steady State (Tmax,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.05 hours (h) before dosing and 0.5-1h, 2h, 3h, 4h, 5h, 6h, 8h after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: tmax,ss represents the time from dosing to the maximum concentration of afatinib in plasma at steady state

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Concentration of Herceptin in Plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.05 hours (h) before dosing and 0.5-1h, 2h, 3h, 4h, 5h, 6h, 8h after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Pre-dose Concentrations of Herceptin in Plasma on Days 8, 15 and 29 (Cpre,8, Cpre,15 and Cpre,29) and Maximum Concentration of Herceptin in Plasma on Days 1, 15 and 29 (Cmax,1, Cmax,15 and Cmax,29).

arm_group.description: Find maximum tolerated dose of the non-marketed substance:BIBW 2992 given orally with fixed weekly infusion doses of 2mg/kg Herceptin. Escalating doses of BIBW 2992 starting at 20mg daily.

intervention.description: Increased dose cohorts from low dose to MTD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Female patients aged >18 years.
2. Advanced or metastatic breast cancer that over-expresses HER2 (immunohistochemistry 3+ or 2+ and gene amplification by FISH). Prior treatment with Herceptin® or Lapatinib® (in the adjuvant or metastatic settings) is permitted but not required.
Exclusion criteria:
Patients with untreated or symptomatic brain metastases. Prior treatment with EGFR targeting therapies or treatment with EGFR- or HER2 inhibiting drugs within the past four weeks before the start of therapy or concomitantly with this study.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was an open-label dose escalation study using a standard 3+3 dose escalation design, dose cohorts are presented here.

group.title: Afatinib 20mg + Herceptin
group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 20mg film-coated tablets and once weekly an intravenous infusion of Herceptin (4 mg/kg single loading dose to be followed by 2 mg/kg/week i.v.) until disease progression or lack of clinical benefit.

group.title: Afatinib 30mg + Herceptin
group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 30mg film-coated tablets and once weekly an intravenous infusion of Herceptin (4 mg/kg single loading dose to be followed by 2 mg/kg/week i.v.) until disease progression or lack of clinical benefit.

group.title: Afatinib 20mg + Herceptin
group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 20mg film-coated tablets and once weekly an intravenous infusion of Herceptin (4 mg/kg single loading dose to be followed by 2 mg/kg/week i.v.) until disease progression or lack of clinical benefit.

group.title: Afatinib 30mg + Herceptin
group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 30mg film-coated tablets and once weekly an intravenous infusion of Herceptin (4 mg/kg single loading dose to be followed by 2 mg/kg/week i.v.) until disease progression or lack of clinical benefit.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
outcome.description: Number of participants with DLT in the first cycle (28 days) for the determination of the maximum tolerated dose (MTD). Important Limitations and Caveats are provided in the respective section.
outcome.population: Treated set (TS). TS consisted of all patients who were dispensed study medication and have taken at least 1 dose of Afatinib. 3 patients were excluded as they were not evaluable for determination of maximum tolerated dose.

group.title: Afatinib 20mg + Herceptin
group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 20mg film-coated tablets and once weekly an intravenous infusion of Herceptin until disease progression or lack of clinical benefit. This group includes patients from the dose-escalation cohort and from the expansion cohort.

group.title: Afatinib 30mg + Herceptin
group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 30mg film-coated tablets and once weekly an intravenous infusion of Herceptin until disease progression or lack of clinical benefit.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
measure.description: Number of participants with DLT in the first cycle (28 days) for the determination of the maximum tolerated dose (MTD). Important Limitations and Caveats are provided in the respective section.
measure.population: Treated set (TS). TS consisted of all patients who were dispensed study medication and have taken at least 1 dose of Afatinib. 3 patients were excluded as they were not evaluable for determination of maximum tolerated dose.

outcome.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Afatinib in Combination With Herceptin(R)
outcome.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose at which no more than 1 of 6 patients experienced DLT. It was determined using a standard 3 + 3 dose escalation cohort design. To confirm the MTD, the MTD cohort was to be expanded to 18 patients with no more than 3/18 patients experiencing a DLT. Please refer to CAVEATs and Limitations.
outcome.population: TS consisted of all patients who were dispensed study medication and have taken at least 1 dose of Afatinib. 3 patients were excluded as they were not evaluable for determination of maximum tolerated dose.

group.title: Afatinib
group.description: All patients received both Afatinib and Herceptin. Dose level 1 was continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 20mg tablets and once weekly an intravenous infusion of Herceptin. Dose level 2 was continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 30mg tablets and once weekly an intravenous infusion of Herceptin. Cycle length was 28 days.

measure.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Afatinib in Combination With Herceptin(R)
measure.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose at which no more than 1 of 6 patients experienced DLT. It was determined using a standard 3 + 3 dose escalation cohort design. To confirm the MTD, the MTD cohort was to be expanded to 18 patients with no more than 3/18 patients experiencing a DLT. Please refer to CAVEATs and Limitations.
measure.population: TS consisted of all patients who were dispensed study medication and have taken at least 1 dose of Afatinib. 3 patients were excluded as they were not evaluable for determination of maximum tolerated dose.

reported_events.time_frame: First administration of trial medication until 28 days after last administration of trial medication (up to 1296 days)

group.title: Afatinib 20mg + Herceptin
group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 20mg film-coated tablets and once weekly an intravenous infusion of Herceptin (4 mg/kg single loading dose to be followed by 2 mg/kg/week i.v.) until disease progression.

group.title: Afatinib 30mg + Herceptin
group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 30mg film-coated tablets and once weekly an intravenous infusion of Herceptin (4 mg/kg single loading dose to be followed by 2 mg/kg/week i.v.) until disease progression.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI’s intellectual property rights.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: MTD was determined at 20mg afatinib when 1/6 pat. had DLT (3+3 design). Upon expansion of MTD cohort to 18 pat. recruitment was stopped when 4/13 pat. had DLT. No lower afatinib dose could be tested as 20mg was the lowest dose formulation available.
